snippet: The state Senate on Monday passed a plan that expands a ban on assault weapons and includes measures focused on people with mental illnesses. The Assembly planned to vote Tuesday on the bill.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo and New York State lawmakers agree to broad package of changes to gun laws that would expand state’s ban on assault weapons and would include measures to keep guns away from mentally ill; state Senate approves in lopsided vote of 43 to 18, and Assembly, where Democrats supporting gun control are in majority, has scheduled vote; passage would make New York first state to act in response to Newtown, Conn, massacre.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: The state Senate on Monday passed a plan that expands a ban on assault weapons and includes measures focused on people with mental illnesses. The Assembly planned to vote Tuesday on the bill.

headline.seo: New York Lawmakers Reach Deal on New Gun Curbs
headline.main: New York Has Gun Deal, With Focus on Mental Ills
headline.print_headline:
New York Has Gun Deal, With Focus on Mental Ills; Obama’s Plan to Be Broad: State Lawmakers
Approve Bill
by 43 to 18
